c74object.name: fluid.kdtree~

div.p: A K-Dimensional tree for efficient neighbourhood searches of multi-dimensional data.
See https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/neighbors.html#nearest-neighbor-algorithms for more on KD Trees

c74object.discussion:
Open the Overview Patch
fluid.kdtree~ is part of the Fluid Decomposition Toolkit of the FluCoMa project. For more explanations, learning material, and discussions on its musicianly uses, visit flucoma.org.

method.name: reset
method.digest: Return the object to its original state
method.description: Calling reset will change parameter values back to those the object was created with, i.e. any attribute values set in the box will be retained

div.p: Build the tree by scanning the points of a fluid.dataset~

ul.li:
dataSet:
The fluid.dataset~ of interest. This can either be a data set object itself, or the name of one.

div.p: Returns the IDs of the k points nearest to the one passed.

ul.li:
buffer:
A buffer~ containing a data point to match against. The number of frames in the buffer must match the dimensionality of the fluid.dataset~ the tree was fitted to.

div.p: Get the distances of the K nearest neighbours to a point.

ul.li:
buffer:
A buffer~ containing a data point to match against. The number of frames in the buffer must match the dimensionality of the fluid.dataset~ the tree was fitted to.

div.p: The number of columns (dimensions) in this model or dataset / labeset
Resets the internal state of the model
The number of data points (entries / observations) in this model or dataset / labeset

method.name: load
method.description: Replace the internal state of the object from a dict. The message should take the form load dictionary <dictid>

method.name: dump
method.digest: Dump the state of this object from the dump outlet as a dict.

method.name: write
method.description: Save the internal state of the object to a JSON file on disk. With no argument, a file dialog will appear to choose the file.

method.name: read
method.description: Replace the internal state of the object from a JSON file on disk. With no argument, a file dialog will appear to choose the file.

div.p: The number of neighbours to return.
Enable warnings to be issued whenever a parameter value is constrained (e.g. clipped)
